file_content.text: The mining platform is secure. Send the engineering team.
Engineering team moving in.
Get to your stations. Beddek, load the drill program. Vann, warm up the laser.
One platform down, two to go, and the next has a Regulator battalion around it.
The Archon sent hovertanks, an air force and armored marines led by the Warhound.
Should I have heard of him?
The Warhound?
The second I head for another platform, the Archon's forces will retake this location. Suggestions?
We need to defend this place.
To stand alone against an army is a glorious thing. Bring on the next fight.
I'm starting to enjoy this.
Sending the tactical data your way, then.
The Warhound founded our favorite mercenary company. Seventy years old and sealed in a battle suit.... He's commandeered dreadnaughts, and he's our second-biggest problem.
Top pick is the skyfighters built for low-atmosphere combat. They'll shred our engineers unless we get some portable artillery.
I can spare a few guards. We'll spread ourselves thin, but it's all we can do.
Check the generator!
Ready the next group of engineers. I will signal when the platform is clear.
Prepare to send in the crew.
If we need the Warhound's equipment, any chance we can buy out his contract?
Can we make him an ally?
Let the skyfighters come. I'll bring them down one by one.
Skyfighters can't touch me.
I suspect the mercenaries have all the equipment we need. Where can I find anti-air rockets?
We can raid enemy supplies.
I take it you didn't bring a full arsenal to Makeb?
You don't have what we need?
It's not you I'm worried about--it's the bombing run after you're gone.
But the Warhound's squad is armed with heavy rockets. They'll take apart the skyfighters nicely if you can borrow a few.
Nearest armory is a bit far. But... the Warhound's own squad carries P-20 seeker missiles. Should do the trick nicely.
I'll seize the rockets from his men's corpses and set the sky on fire.
This will get bloody.
Only so much room on the shuttle. I brought rations instead of missiles. My mistake.
Even skyfighters cannot resist the power of the Force. Still, if there are tools built for the job, we may as well use them.
Rocketry. Crude, but it'll do.
It's been a while since I shot remotes during training. But I imagine the principle is the same.
Just like target practice.
The best enemies carry the best weapons. Anything else?
I always enjoy new hardware.
If you can take out the Warhound himself, it'll hit morale hard--but trophies are no good if our engineers are bleeding or in pieces.
Support team out. Good luck.
I don't know anything about him, but probably not. I'd say take him down if you get a shot, but it's not my call.
